problem_text:
Problem 12. Let G be an abelian group of size N, and suppose that A ⊂ G has density α. Are there at least α15N 10 tuples (x1, . . . , x5, y1, . . . , y5) ∈ G10 such that xi + yj ∈ A whenever j ∈ {i, i + 1, i + 2}?
Comments. This is very closely related to the Cayley graph case of simplest unknown instance of Sidorenko’s conjecture for graphs, that of the ‘Möbius ladder’ K5,5 \ C10.
